meeting_annotations.speaker: Melanie Gareau
meeting_annotations.transcript: So if I can go back to the metabolites, I know that we we use using chambers to study intestinal physiology, so we can look at ion transport and permeability in pretty good detail. Um with respect to the correlation versus association, the best one that I know of is IBD where you can measure permeability defects in patients before they become IBD patients if you'll do a screen. So it suggests that permeability is one of the initiating factors, whether that's caused by microbiome changes is unknown at the time right now, but certainly genetic susceptibility is correlated with that.
